result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert V Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In lieu of costs defendant to serve 2 days jail consecutive to the 30 days jail sentence.
In lieu of DNA Surcharge defendant to serve 2 days consecutive to the 30 days jail sentence.
Straight time (without work release).  May be transferred to Milwaukee County.
Defendant needs to provide DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert V Simmons in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Kelly Pingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Rumpf makes statements. Defendant makes statements.  
Court orders the following:  30 days jail without work release (0 days credit).  Maybe transferred to Milwaukee County.  
Costs:  $253.00 due immediately, in lieu of costs, defendant to serve 2 days in jail consecutive to the 30 days.  
DNA $200.00 in lieu of costs, defendant to serve 2 days in jail consecutive to the 30 days.  
Defendant needs to provide a DNA sample.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
